channel.title: General suggestions
channel.description:
Hey, First of all, i really enjoy this game alot and i would like to see it grow. Here are some suggestions which i believe would improve services quality and customers experience.
Chat for friends (whispers) in lobby and main menu area. Invite players as friend from chat in lobby, game creating waiting room and in game (invite friend button).
Logs from chats (lobby+in game), so you can check them through afterwards (players can learn this way from their mistakes etc.).
Player list from last played matches (so you can add friends afterwards). Some sort of simple match history list, which shows Win/Lose+player list or just same list/table which presented after every match.
After match reveal who were who, in game, lower right corner.
After match lobby, show playerID, ingame name and number in chat, so its easier to identify who were who in match. Show players leaving chatlobby (simple, "player+nr left chat").
Maybe lower price of the game to increase player base. Like i said i think game is brilliant. And i know its "indie" game so i totally understand if these implementions are not coming for the game, but i still guess customers would have use for these functions.
Best Regards, Ghuz

item.title: General suggestions
item.dc:creator: Ghuzlol
item.description:
It really aint about what i want. I said i belive these will enhance the quality of the game and obv i was not clear enough about player list. What i ment is a list and match history “reports” which you can open up after you have left game for main menu. Or when you launch your game you can check last played matches.

In game when the winning faction is announced, reveal player roles to bottom right “player box”.

After match in chat show playerID+nr they played with and name they were in match (this is not that important tho).

Maybe some discounts or something, most people are not willing to pay even 10e/USD for game they are not so sure about in first place. And this really depends on marketing area (US varies from EU markets). You might also argue lowering price would bring players whom dont really get a hang of the game or are simply trolling. But if there is going to be issues in player pool and players cant get games going, you could try put up some discounts on Steam.
